title: Maintenance & Sanitation
description: Comprehensive maintenance and sanitation requirements including preventative maintenance programs, cleaning schedules and procedures, sanitation logs, filter maintenance, cooling unit servicing, glass and brittle plastic management, air circulation control, and light protection

requirements.text: Does the operation have a preventative maintenance program that includes a schedule and completion records?
mandatoryStatements: Preventative maintenance (PM) program is documented
PM schedule identifies all equipment requiring maintenance
Schedule specifies maintenance frequency for each equipment item
PM activities are defined for each equipment type
Completion records document when maintenance was performed
Records show who performed maintenance
Program prevents equipment failures that could impact food safety
requirements.verificationExpectations: Quarterly verification that PM schedule is followed and records are complete
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Monthly review of PM completion, immediate attention to overdue maintenance

requirements.text: Are there logs of maintenance work and repairs and are they signed off when work is completed?
mandatoryStatements: Maintenance work logs are maintained for all equipment
Repair logs document corrective maintenance activities
Logs include date, equipment description, and work performed
Logs show who performed the maintenance or repair
Work completion is signed off by responsible person
Parts used and materials replaced are documented
Logs are organized and retrievable
requirements.verificationExpectations: Quarterly review of maintenance logs for completeness and proper sign-off
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Weekly verification that maintenance work is logged and signed off upon completion

requirements.text: Is there a written cleaning schedule (Master Sanitation Schedule) that shows what and where is to be cleaned and how often?
mandatoryStatements: Master Sanitation Schedule (MSS) is documented in writing
MSS identifies all areas, equipment, and surfaces to be cleaned
MSS specifies cleaning frequency for each item (daily, weekly, monthly, etc.)
MSS covers entire facility including growing areas, storage, and support areas
MSS includes both routine and deep cleaning activities
MSS is updated when facility or equipment changes occur
Responsibility for cleaning activities is assigned
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual review of MSS for completeness and accuracy, quarterly verification that MSS is followed
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Weekly monitoring of cleaning schedule adherence, immediate attention to missed cleaning activities

requirements.text: Are there written cleaning and sanitation procedures (Sanitation Standard Operating Procedures) for the indoor agriculture operation and all equipment that includes the frequency of cleaning and sanitizing, and instructions including chemical use details?
mandatoryStatements: Sanitation Standard Operating Procedures (SSOP) are documented
SSOP cover the entire indoor agriculture operation
SSOP include procedures for all food contact equipment
Procedures specify cleaning and sanitizing frequency
Procedures include step-by-step instructions
Chemical use details are specified (concentration, contact time, application method)
Procedures address both cleaning (soil removal) and sanitizing (microbial reduction)
SSOP are accessible to cleaning personnel
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual review of SSOP for accuracy and completeness, quarterly verification that procedures are followed
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Weekly observation of sanitation activities, verification that procedures are followed correctly

requirements.text: Are cleaning and sanitation logs on file that show what was done, when and by who and details strength testing of anti-microbial solution used to sanitize surfaces?
mandatoryStatements: Cleaning and sanitation logs are maintained
Logs document what areas or equipment were cleaned
Logs show when cleaning was performed (date and time)
Logs identify who performed the cleaning
Logs include antimicrobial solution concentration test results
Test results confirm sanitizer strength meets specifications
Logs demonstrate that MSS and SSOP are being followed
Logs are reviewed and signed off by supervisor
requirements.verificationExpectations: Weekly review of sanitation logs for completeness and compliance with SSOP
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Daily verification of sanitation log completion, immediate follow-up on missed activities or failed tests

requirements.text: Where used, are there records showing filters in air conditioning, evaporative coolers, ventilation and air filtration units are regularly cleaned and replaced?
mandatoryStatements: If air conditioning or ventilation systems used, filter maintenance records exist
Records show filter cleaning frequency
Records show filter replacement frequency
Filter maintenance schedule is based on manufacturer recommendations or operational needs
Records identify which units were serviced
Records show dates of filter cleaning/replacement
Clean filters maintain air quality and system efficiency
requirements.verificationExpectations: Quarterly verification of filter maintenance records and schedule compliance
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Monthly checks of filter condition, adherence to cleaning/replacement schedule

requirements.text: Where used, are there records showing cooling units are maintenance serviced and cleaned at least every 12 months or more frequently as required?
mandatoryStatements: If cooling units used, maintenance service records exist
Records show cooling units serviced at least annually (every 12 months)
More frequent servicing if required by manufacturer or operational conditions
Service includes cleaning of cooling units
Records identify specific units serviced
Records show date of service and work performed
Service maintains cooling unit performance and prevents contamination
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual verification that all cooling units have been serviced within required timeframe
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Quarterly review of cooling unit service schedule, advance scheduling to ensure timely service

requirements.text: Is there a documented glass and brittle plastic management procedure (including company glass and brittle plastic policy, glass breakage procedure and where necessary a glass register)?
mandatoryStatements: Glass and brittle plastic management procedure is documented
Company policy on glass and brittle plastic in facility is defined
Glass breakage response procedure is established
Procedure includes product hold and area inspection protocols
Glass register maintained if glass items present in facility (where necessary)
Register identifies all glass and brittle plastic items by location
Regular inspection of glass and brittle plastic items for integrity
Personnel trained on glass breakage response
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual review of glass and brittle plastic management program, quarterly verification of glass register accuracy
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Weekly inspection of glass and brittle plastic items, immediate response to any breakage per procedure

requirements.text: If fans, or other air circulation equipment are used, are they operated in a manner that minimizes the potential for contaminating product, equipment, or packaging materials?
mandatoryStatements: If fans or air circulation equipment used, operation is controlled to prevent contamination
Airflow patterns direct air away from exposed product
Fans do not blow debris or contaminants onto product or food contact surfaces
Air circulation equipment is positioned appropriately
Equipment is clean and well-maintained
Airflow direction is evaluated as part of facility design or risk assessment
requirements.verificationExpectations: Quarterly verification that air circulation equipment is positioned and operated appropriately
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Weekly checks of fan operation and cleanliness, immediate adjustment if contamination risk identified

requirements.text: Are all lights in the facility that could potentially contaminate raw materials (e.g., seeds, transplants, soil, media), product, equipment or packaging shielded, coated or otherwise shatter resistant to protect product from contamination in the event of a breakage?
mandatoryStatements: All lights above or near raw materials, product, equipment, or packaging are protected
Light protection includes shields, coatings, or shatter-resistant bulbs/tubes
Protection prevents glass or material contamination in event of breakage
All areas where contamination could occur are covered by light protection policy
Broken or missing light protection is immediately replaced
Light protection is inspected regularly for integrity
Alternative lighting (LED, shatter-resistant) used where appropriate
requirements.verificationExpectations: Quarterly inspection of all light fixtures for adequate protection
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Monthly checks of light protection integrity, immediate repair or replacement of damaged protection

capaInject: If PM program not established or not followed: develop program within 30 days, immediate attention to overdue maintenance
If maintenance logs not maintained: establish logging system immediately, retroactively document recent maintenance within 7 days
If Master Sanitation Schedule not documented: develop MSS within 14 days, implement immediately
If SSOP not documented: develop SSOP within 14 days, train personnel on procedures within 7 days
If sanitation logs incomplete: immediate completion of current logs, implement daily verification process
If filter maintenance records missing: establish records immediately, service all filters within 30 days
If cooling units not serviced per schedule: immediate scheduling of service, complete within 30 days
If glass management procedure not documented: develop procedure within 14 days, conduct glass inventory within 7 days
If fans create contamination risk: immediate adjustment of fan operation, evaluate and reposition as needed
If light protection missing or damaged: immediate installation of protection or temporary measures, permanent correction within 48 hours
traceabilityInject: Preventative maintenance records must be traceable to specific equipment, dates, and activities
Sanitation logs must be traceable to specific areas, equipment, cleaning dates, and personnel
Antimicrobial concentration test results must be traceable to specific solutions and applications
Glass breakage incidents must be fully documented with traceability to affected areas and product disposition
Filter and cooling unit maintenance must be traceable to specific units and service dates
